required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Immune Response of Novartis of MenACWY Conjugate Vaccine When Given to Healthy Children
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Randomized, Observer-blind, Multi-Center Study to Compare the Safety and Immunogenicity of One Dose of Novartis Meningococcal ACWY Conjugate Vaccine With One Dose of Licensed Meningococcal ACWY Conjugate Vaccine Administered to Healthy Children 2-10 Years of Age

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the safety and immune response of Novartis MenACWY conjugate vaccine when given to healthy children compared to a licensed Meningococcal ACWY polysaccharide-protein conjugate vaccine.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentages of Subjects With hSBA Seroresponse, in Healthy Children 2 to 5 Years of Age
primary_outcome.description: The immunogenicity of a single dose of MenACWY-CRM is compared with the immunogenicity of a single dose of the licensed ACWY polysaccharide vaccine, in terms of the percentages of subjects with seroresponse directed against N. meningitidis serogroups A, C, W-135, and Y. Seroresponse: For a subject with hSBA <1:4 at baseline, seroresponse is defined as a postvaccination hSBA ≥ 1:8; for a subject with hSBA ≥ 1:4 at baseline, seroresponse is defined as a postvaccination hSBA titer of at least 4 times the baseline.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentages of Subjects With hSBA Seroresponse, in Healthy Children 6 to 10 Years of Age.
primary_outcome.description: The immunogenicity of a single dose of MenACWY-CRM is compared with the immunogenicity of a single dose of the licensed ACWY polysaccharide vaccine, in terms of the percenatages of subjects with seroresponse directed against N. meningitidis serogroups A, C, W-135, and Y. Seroresponse: For a subject with hSBA <1:4 at baseline, seroresponse is defined as a postvaccination hSBA ≥ 1:8; for a subject with hSBA ≥ 1:4 at baseline, seroresponse is defined as a postvaccination hSBA titer of at least 4 times the baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentages of Subjects With hSBA Seroresponse, in Healthy Children 2 to 10 Years of Age.
secondary_outcome.description: The immunogenicity of a single dose of MenACWY-CRM is compared with the immunogenicity of a single dose of the licensed ACWY polysaccharide vaccine, in terms of the percentages of subjects with seroresponse directed against N. meningitidis serogroups A, C, W-135, and Y. Seroresponse: For a subject with hSBA <1:4 at baseline, seroresponse is defined as a postvaccination hSBA ≥ 1:8; for a subject with hSBA ≥ 1:4 at baseline, seroresponse is defined as a postvaccination hSBA titer of at least 4 times the baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentages of Subjects With hSBA ≥ 1:8, in Healthy Children 2 to 10 Years of Age
secondary_outcome.description: The immunogenicity of a single dose of MenACWY-CRM is compared with the immunogenicity of a single dose of the licensed ACWY polysaccharide vaccine, in terms of the percentages of subjects with seroresponse directed against N. meningitidis serogroups A, C, W-135, and Y. Seroresponse: For a subject with hSBA <1:4 at baseline, seroresponse is defined as a postvaccination hSBA ≥ 1:8; for a subject with hSBA ≥ 1:4 at baseline, seroresponse is defined as a postvaccination hSBA titer of at least 4 times the baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Titers (hSBA), in Healthy Children 2 to 10 Years of Age.
secondary_outcome.description: The immunogenicity of a single dose of MenACWY-CRM is compared with the immunogenicity of a single dose of the licensed ACWY polysaccharide vaccine, in terms of the number of subjects with hSBA (human Serum Bactericidal Activity) Geometric Mean Titers (GMTs) response against N. meningitidis serogroups A, C, W-135, and Y.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentages of Subjects With hSBA ≥ 1:8, in Healthy Children 2 to 5 and 6 to 10 Years of Age.
secondary_outcome.description: The immunogenicity of a single dose of MenACWY-CRM is compared with the immunogenicity of a single dose of the licensed ACWY polysaccharide vaccine, in terms of the percenategs of subjects with seroresponse directed against N. meningitidis serogroups A, C, W-135, and Y.

secondary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Titers (hSBA), in Healthy Children 2 to 5 and 6 to 10 Years of Age.
secondary_outcome.description: The immunogenicity of a single dose of the Novartis MenACWY-CRM is compared with the immunogenicity of a single dose of the licensed ACWY polysaccharide vaccine, in terms of the number of subjects with hSBA (human Serum Bacterial Activity) Geometric Mean Titers (GMTs) response against N. meningitidis serogroups A, C, W-135, and Y.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentages of Subjects With hSBA Seroresponse, in Healthy Children 2 to 5 Years of Age (2 Doses vs 1 Dose)
secondary_outcome.description: The immunogenicity of two doses of the Novartis MenACWY-CRM, administered 2 months apart, is compared with the immunogenicity of a single dose of the Novartis MenACWY-CRM, directed against N. meningitidis serogroups A, C, W-135, and Y. Seroresponse: For a subject with hSBA <1:4 at baseline, seroresponse is defined as a postvaccination hSBA ≥ 1:8; for a subject with hSBA ≥ 1:4 at baseline, seroresponse is defined as a postvaccination hSBA titer of at least 4 times the baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentages of Subjects With hSBA ≥ 1:8, in Healthy Children 2 to 5 Years of Age (2 Doses v/s 1 Dose)
secondary_outcome.description: The immunogenicity of two doses of the Novartis MenACWY-CRM, administered 2 months apart, is compared with the immunogenicity of a single dose of the Novartis MenACWY-CRM, directed against N. meningitidis serogroups A, C, W-135, and Y. Seroresponse: For a subject with hSBA <1:4 at baseline, seroresponse is defined as a postvaccination hSBA ≥ 1:8; for a subject with hSBA ≥ 1:4 at baseline, seroresponse is defined as a postvaccination hSBA titer of at least 4 times the baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: GMTs (hSBA) in Healthy Children 2 to 5 Years of Age (2 Doses v/s 1 Dose)
secondary_outcome.description: The immunogenicity of two doses of the Novartis MenACWY-CRM vaccine, administered 2 months apart, is compared with the immunogenicity of a single dose of the Novartis MenACWY-CRM vaccine, in terms of hSBA (human Serum Bactericidal Activity) GMTs (Geometric Mean Titers) against N. meningitidis serogroups A, C, W-135, and Y. ANOVA model used for the analysis of this outcome is different compare to ANOVA model used for the other outcome. The computed model components vary according to the variance observed due to the different datasets.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentages of Subjects With at Least One Reactogenicity Sign After Vaccination in Children 2 to 5 Years of Age - 1 Dose Vaccine Treatment.
secondary_outcome.description: Safety was assessed in terms of the percentages of subjects with reported local and systemic reactions up to 7 days after each vaccination per vaccination group, after 1 dose treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentages of Subjects With at Least One Reactogenicity Sign After Vaccination in Children 6 to 10 Years of Age - 1 Dose Vaccine Treatment.
secondary_outcome.description: Safety was assessed in terms of the percentages of subjects with reported local and systemic reactions up to 7 days after each vaccination per vaccination group after 1 dose treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentages of Subjects With Unsolicited AEs Occurring Throughout the Study in Children Aged 2 to 10 Years - 1 Dose Vaccine Treatment.
secondary_outcome.description: Safety was assessed in terms of the percentage of subjects with unsolicited AEs occurring throughout the entire study period, after 1 dose treatment.

arm_group.description: 1 injection of the Novartis MenACWY-CRM (a nontoxic mutant of diptheria toxin) conjugate vaccine administered by intramuscular (IM) injection on study day 1.
1 injection of a licensed meningococcal MenACWY polysaccharide-protein conjugate vaccine administered by intramuscular (IM) injection on study day 1
2 injections of the Novartis MenACWY-CRM (a nontoxic mutant of diptheria toxin) conjugate vaccine administered by intramuscular (IM) injection on study days 1 and 61.

intervention.description: 1 injection of the Novartis MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine administered intramuscularly
2 injections of the Novartis MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine administered intramuscularly to children 2 to 5 years of age
1 injection of the licensed meningococcal ACWY was administered intramuscularly

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- healthy 2-10 years of age children, inclusive and for whom, after the nature of the study has been explained, the parent or legal guardian has provided written informed consent
- who are available for all visits and telephone calls scheduled for the study
- who are up-to-date with age-appropriate routine childhood vaccinations
Exclusion Criteria:
- whose parent or legal guardian is unwilling or unable to give written informed consent
- who had a previous or suspected disease caused by N. meningitidis;
- who have previously been immunized with a meningococcal vaccine or vaccine containing meningococcal antigen(s)
- who have received any investigational agents or vaccines within 90 days prior to enrollment
- who have any serious acute, chronic or progressive disease
- who have epilepsy or any progressive neurological disease or history of Guillain Barré Syndrome
- who have a history of anaphylaxis, serious vaccine reactions
- who have a known or suspected impairment/alteration of immune function, either congenital or acquired or resulting from
- who are known to have a bleeding diathesis, or any condition that may be associated with a prolonged bleeding time
- who have Down's syndrome or other known cytogenic disorders

facility.name: St. Louis University School of Medicine

results_reference.citation: Halperin SA, Gupta A, Jeanfreau R, Klein NP, Reisinger K, Walter E, Bedell L, Gill C, Dull PM. Comparison of the safety and immunogenicity of an investigational and a licensed quadrivalent meningococcal conjugate vaccine in children 2-10 years of age. Vaccine. 2010 Nov 23;28(50):7865-72. doi: 10.1016/j.vaccine.2010.09.092. Epub 2010 Oct 29.

clinical_study.keyword: prevention of meningococcal disease serogroups ACWY

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were enrolled at 67 centers in the USA and Canada.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: All subjects enrolled were included in the trial.

group.title: MenACWY-CRM (2 Doses)
group.description: 2 injections of the Novartis MenACWY-CRM (a nontoxic mutant of diptheria toxin) vaccine administered by intramuscular (IM) injection on study days 1 and 61 in children 2 to 5 years of age

group.description: The Novartis MenACWY-CRM vaccine was administered by IM in children 2 to 5 years of age.

group.title: Licensed Polysaccharide Vaccine (1 Dose)
group.description: The licensed meningococcal MenACWY polysaccharide vaccine was administered by IM in children 2 to 5 years of age.

measure.title: Percentages of Subjects With at Least One Reactogenicity Sign After Vaccination in Children 2 to 5 Years of Age - 1 Dose Vaccine Treatment.
measure.description: Safety was assessed in terms of the percentages of subjects with reported local and systemic reactions up to 7 days after each vaccination per vaccination group, after 1 dose treatment.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the safety population. Only groups receiving 1 dose vaccine are reported.

outcome.title: Percentages of Subjects With at Least One Reactogenicity Sign After Vaccination in Children 6 to 10 Years of Age - 1 Dose Vaccine Treatment.
outcome.description: Safety was assessed in terms of the percentages of subjects with reported local and systemic reactions up to 7 days after each vaccination per vaccination group after 1 dose treatment.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the safety population. Only groups receiving 1 dose vaccine are reported.

group.title: MenACWY-CRM (1 Dose)
group.description: The Novartis MenACWY-CRM vaccine was administered by IM in children 6 to 10 years of age.

group.title: Licensed Polysaccharide Vaccine (1 Dose)
group.description: The licensed meningococcal MenACWY polysaccharide vaccine was administered by IM in children 6 to 10 years of age.

measure.title: Percentages of Subjects With at Least One Reactogenicity Sign After Vaccination in Children 6 to 10 Years of Age - 1 Dose Vaccine Treatment.
measure.description: Safety was assessed in terms of the percentages of subjects with reported local and systemic reactions up to 7 days after each vaccination per vaccination group after 1 dose treatment.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the safety population. Only groups receiving 1 dose vaccine are reported.

outcome.title: Percentages of Subjects With Unsolicited AEs Occurring Throughout the Study in Children Aged 2 to 10 Years - 1 Dose Vaccine Treatment.
outcome.description: Safety was assessed in terms of the percentage of subjects with unsolicited AEs occurring throughout the entire study period, after 1 dose treatment.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on safety population. Only groups receiving 1 dose vaccine are reported.

group.title: MenACWY-CRM (1 Dose)
group.description: 1 injection of the Novartis MenACWY-CRM (a nontoxic diptheria toxin) vaccine administered on study day 1

group.title: Licensed Polysaccharide Vaccine (1 Dose)
group.description: 1 injection of the licensed meningococcal MenACWY polysaccharide vaccine administered on study day 1

measure.title: Percentages of Subjects With Unsolicited AEs Occurring Throughout the Study in Children Aged 2 to 10 Years - 1 Dose Vaccine Treatment.
measure.description: Safety was assessed in terms of the percentage of subjects with unsolicited AEs occurring throughout the entire study period, after 1 dose treatment.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on safety population. Only groups receiving 1 dose vaccine are reported.

reported_events.time_frame: All adverse events and serious adverse events were collectedfrom day 1 to study terminaton (day 240).
reported_events.desc: If the adverse event was solicited then the event is listed as systematic assessment. However, if the adverse event was not solicited (i.e., unsolicited), then the event is listed under non-systematic method of collection. Subjects not vaccinated were excluded from the safety analysis.

group.title: MenACWY-CRM (2 Doses)
group.description: 2 injections of the Novartis MenACWY-CRM vaccine administered by IM on study days 1 and 61 in children 2 to 5 years of age

group.title: MenACWY-CRM (1 Dose)_2 to 5 Years
group.description: 1 injection of the Novartis MenACWY-CRM vaccine administered on study day 1 in children 2 to 5 years of age.

group.title: MenACWY-CRM (1 Dose)_6 to 10 Years
group.description: 1 injection of the Novartis MenACWY-CRM vaccine administered on study day 1 in children 6 to 10 years of age.

group.title: Licensed Polysaccharide Vaccine_2 to 5 Years
group.description: 1 injection of the licensed meningococcal MenACWY polysaccharide vaccine administered on study day 1 in children 2 to 5 years of age.

group.title: Licensed Polysaccharide Vaccine_6 to 10 Years
group.description: 1 injection of the licensed meningococcal MenACWY polysaccharide vaccine administered on study day 1 in children 6 to 10 years of age.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
